name: (1Z)-1-[(2E)-1-benzyl-3-phenyl-2-(phenylhydrazono)propylidene]-2-phenylhydrazine
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-960
Reason: 1-benzyl-3-phenyl-2-(phenylhydrazono)propylidene and phenylhydrazine functionalities significantly impact the melting point. The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 °C. The introduction of the phenyl group and the propylidene chain increases the melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. The benzyl group introduces a rigid structure and additional molecular weight, estimated at around +20 °C. The phenyl group introduces additional pi-stacking interactions and rigidity, estimated at around +30 °C. The hydrazono group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +20 °C. The propylidene chain introduces additional rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +10 °C.
